critique: The executive order appears to be a formal delegation of authority regarding personnel matters. It doesn't seem designed to evoke strong emotions. The primary goal is to communicate a legal and administrative decision. Therefore, the scores for all emotions should be relatively low. I will set joy, sadness, fear, disgust, and surprise all to 1 initially. After further consideration, I don't think any of these emotions are intended to be conveyed, so I will keep the scores at 1.
